output_list.description: The vulnerability exists in the line `totalAmount += _amounts[a];`. The integer overflow in the calculation of `totalAmount` allows an attacker to set `totalAmount` to any value, effectively allowing them to set an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
Refund logic is improperly tied to state updates, enabling DoS attacks.
Relies on outdated constructor naming conventions prone to typos.
Relies on outdated constructor naming conventions prone to typos.
Contract lockup and loss of usability.
Contract lockup and loss of usability.
Relies on outdated constructor naming conventions prone to typos.

The vulnerability exists in the line `totalAmount += _amounts[a];`. The integer overflow in the calculation of `totalAmount` allows an attacker to set `totalAmount` to any value, effectively allowing them to set an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
Refund logic is improperly tied to state updates, enabling DoS attacks.
Relies on outdated constructor naming conventions prone to typos.
